content:
First, install Provider for CalDAV & CardDAV, then launch TbSync, Account Actions, Add new account, CalDAV & Card DAV, select the Yahoo server profile, click Next, and follow the instructions to enter the account address and an app password.

If you have multiple calendars visible, the events from all of them are shown in the same calendar tab.

content: I tried following this advice because I am having difficulty using my usual method of "discovering" calendars on Yahoo (my credentials are not being accepted for some reason) but when I tried installing latest "provider for Caldav" I am being told that it is not compatible with my version of Thunderbird (102.11.0 64-bit) any suggestions? please
creator: bambukouk

content:
The TbSync/Provider add-ons are no longer needed since TB supports CalDAV. For Yahoo:

"Sync Yahoo Calendar with other CalDAV supported devices. Steps vary by device, but you must enter your Yahoo ID and the app generated password as well as the CalDAV URL associated with your account.

In your device settings, enter https://caldav.calendar.yahoo.com in the server URL field."

https://help.yahoo.com/kb/sync-access-calendar-multiple-devices-applications-sln4707.html

content:
È un problema che è stato segnalato anche da altri utenti ma che al momento non ha una soluzione certa, anche perché si presenta solo occasionalmente.

Prova anzitutto se per te può funzionare la soluzione descritta qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1438244#answer-1634071

  • crea un collegamento a Thunderbird sul Desktop
  • apri la finestra Esegui di Windows con la combinazione di tasti Win+R (permi cioè il tasto Windows sulla tastiera e contemporaneamente il tasto R)
  • digita in Esegui il comando shell:sendto e premi invio
  • si aprirà la cartella SendTo
  • Sposta il collegamento a Thunderbird dal Desktop a SendTo

content:
Nella cache di Firefox vengono salvate temporaneamente immagini, script e altri elementi dei siti web visitati, allo scopo di velocizzare la navigazione -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/Come%20cancellare%20il%20contenuto%20della%20cache

Se vuoi eliminare anche altre informazioni come la cronologia o i cookie segui invece questa guida -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/Cancellare%20la%20cronologia%20recente
creator: @next

content: Grazie, ma la mia richiesta era per Thunderbird. Sapete dirmi in merito?
creator: silviabrosio.grafica

content:
Opss hai ragione scusami. In Thunderbird la cache contiene una copia ottimizzata dei messaggi che hai già aperto. Serve a riaprire gli stessi messaggi più velocemente. Se cancelli la cache non perdi nessun messaggio ne le configurazione. Potresti però notare una certa lentezza per un po' di tempo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/impostazioni-thunderbird-pannello-avanzate#w_spazio-su-disco

Per maggiore prudenza comunque puoi fare una copia di backup de profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo e poi eliminarla se tutto funziona correttamente, o archiviarla per ulteriore sicurezza.

Yes - I originally installed Thunderbird on my home desktop (let's call it A), set up the account and was delighted with the way it works (unlike BT email which gives me all sorts of problems). content:
Some mail servers store all of the mail folders as sub folders of the inbox. Weird in my view, but apparently it follows some logic known only to mail server admins and developers. Generally this directory name is offered by the server when Thunderbird asks for mail. Sometime it gets it and sometimes not.

Generally these servers also have am IMAP server directory of [Inbox], inbox or INBOX and this can be set in account settings > advanced to make the appearance more like you expect. Which is yours is something to work out.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi Matt, I checked the settings and yes, there are differences between the "Personal namespace" setting (in Advanced Account Settings). For servers where the functional folders are displayed on the same level as the Inbox, this is set to "" while on the server that displays these folders as subfolders of the inbox, this is set to "INBOX".

That would make sense.

What doesn't make sense is that if I change "INBOX" to "", either Thunderbird or the server change it back! I'm just going to ignore this behavior, but I think it is definitely a Thunderbird issue - possibly in combination with whatever mail server is running.

content:
Thanks for the reply but I am not sure if you understood the question.

I have worked out how to achieve my goal using only Thunderbird.

In Thunderbird I create a folder within the GMail account called stagingpost. I find all the emails using quick filter or whatever and have them selected. I move them to staging post which really is just removing the inbox label and adding a stagingpost label. I copy all the emails in stagingpost to the local folder. I delete all the emails in stagingpost and empty bin/trash as and when.

Now I have the messages "backed up" locally.

I have tested this in a new Thunderbird profile with a GMail account with under 100 messsages. I would love someone to test this method as I need to perform it on two family members' GMail accounts who are running out of storage and have 20 and 30 thousands messages in their All Mail folder.

content:
Tu puoi decidere come formattare un messaggio, ma non come lo visualizzerà il tuo destinatario. Ogni client ha un suo modo di lavorare. Gli utenti che ad esempio usano Mutt vedranno solo il testo del messaggio con caratteri standard.

Quanto al copia-incolla, da qualsiasi wordprocessor, darà sempre risultati imprevedibili perché si porterà dietro tutta una serie di paramenti di formattazione nascosti.
creator: @next

content: Hai in buona parte ragione next, ma è particolarmente fastidioso trovarsi a scrivere con un carattere piccolissimo, renderlo con molti sforzi accettabile, magari eliminando i parametri di formattazione con altri editor, e poi riceverlo invece grandissimo, ci vuole qualcosa di più attendibile!
creator: glauco.masotti

content:
Se pensi di riuscire a mettere tutti d'accordo su uno standard, accomodati :) Sono 40 che se ne parla... Senza considerare che il carattere che a te piace potrebbe anche non essere tra quelli installati nel PC del destinatario.

L'unico standard affidabile è l'email di solo testo non formattato.
creator: @next

content: Thunderbird potrebbe proporre un default, anziché uno random. Non è importante che il carattere piaccia, ma sapere cosa aspettarsi. Con quale carattere scrivere i documenti poi è la prima cosa per quasi tutti gli editor.
creator: glauco.masotti

content:
Thunderbird parte con le impostazioni di formattazione che hai dato in Tasto menu > Impostazioni > Composizione

E va avanti con quelle almeno che non incolli roba formattata altrove. Mi sembra che tu stia dando a Thunderbird colpe che sono del tuo metodo di lavoro. Se devi scrivere una mail la scrivi in un client di posta non in Word o quel che è. Se devi inviare documenti con formattazioni particolari ci sono gli allegati.

Se poi conosci un client che ti risolve il problema, passa subito a quello. Non si offende nessuno.

content: try changing to outlook.office365.com and setting authentication to Oauth2
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David. I finally figured out to what you were referring and as I could not respond to ask you for detailed step-by-step directions, I was able to Google search from my cell...One must go to Thunderbird, go to accounts and find "Server Name" - once you find that you can erase/delete the current name (I suggest writing it down in case the next step doesn't work you can always go back). Then you would enter "outlook365.com" or "outlook.office365.com" as the new server name and that solved my issue. All of my current and old emails were available...all 4,000+ new ones, ugh! As of 48 hours ago it is all working fine. I have not changed authentication. If I have more issues, then I will change that next.

content: This is apparently a common problem. Your fix suggests that the product is wrecking itself. Been using TB for years and it does this - just won't retrieve emails suddenly claiming that the server has timed out, as if - yet Aquamail on my phone and Chromebook hasn't the slightest such difficulty. This is basically unacceptable. I understand that this being open source means I should be grateful it works at all, but I'm getting ready to switch if this problem can't be solved except by irradicating the thing on my Win11 machine and reloading from scratch. What kind of product does this? If I was paying for it, I'd want my money back. Does this not bother anyone that the email tool won't retrieve email consistently? I hear BetterBird is named appropriately. Does anyone have experience with this? Is the problem fixable yet the TB crew doesn't know what to do about it? Spending time updating the interface when mail won't arrive consistently seems pretty eccentric from here.
creator: thunderbird9

content:
Spectrum server Server Settings for charter

IMAP - synchronises imap account folders with folders on server as seen in webmail account.

IMAP

  • Incoming Email Server: mobile.charter.net
  • Port: 993
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name: Full email address

POP - can only access and download emails that are in the Inbox on server. There is no synchronisation between any pop account folder and server. So whatever is downloaded is an independent copy on your computer.

  • Incoming Email Server: mobile.charter.net
  • Port: 995
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name: Full email address

SMTP

  • Outgoing Email Server: mobile.charter.net
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name: Full email address

Please note - You cannot simply swap server settings of an imap accoun to use server settings for apop account. Imap or Pop accounts need to be set up as completely separate account if you wish to swap from one to another.

It sounds like you have downloaded oldest mail but nothing since 2020 to current date. I've been trying to find out if there are any imap download/upload limits, but as yet not found any info. As an example gmail will only allow 2500MB (2.5GB) imap download in a 24 hour period. https://support.google.com/a/answer/1071518?hl=en#zippy=

It's possible you have reached a an imap download limit and after 24 hours it might start downloading more.

I'm not sure how many emails you have already aleady downloaded, but if they are all in the Inbox then it may be a good idea to create some folders and move emails in order to organise them. It's also less risky to have all your emails in just one file.


Some general good info especially when it comes to what spectrum auto delete in Spam and Trash folders. https://www.stage-spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-quota-and-settings-bhn-and-twc

content: Settings/General, Config. editor, the preference mail.compose.warn_public_recipients.threshold defaults to 15, so increase it to avoid the warning.
creator: sfhowes

content:
That worked, Thanks!!

Is that setting only for T-bird pop-up messages, or what else? I made it 20. What would happen if I made it 50, or 100, etc. Does it affect any other function?
creator: KJS-LES

content: You can set the number as high as the maximum number of recipients per message that your mail provider allows. Do a test and you will see that the warning returns when the number of contacts exceeds the setting (just discard the message). I'm not aware that it affects any other function.
